actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a one-time, $1,500 credit against income tax for the purchase an automobile manufactured in the United States.

summary.text: Consumer and Automotive Recovery Act of 2008 or the CAR Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individual taxpayers a one-time tax credit for the purchase of a U.S. manufactured motor vehicle with a gross weight rating of not more than 14,000 pounds. Limits the amount of such credit to $1,500.

titles.title: Consumer and Automotive Recovery Act of 2008
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a one-time, $1,500 credit against income tax for the purchase an automobile manufactured in the United States.
